BeginningArabic.Description: This is an introductory class to Modern Standard Arabic and Middle Eastern Culture. Students are expected to reach intermediate low to intermediate mid-level. The Arabic alphabet and sounds are introduced as well as simple language in context reflecting the authentic cultural nuances dealing with simple topics ranging from family, school and hobbies. No prior knowledge is required.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Proficiency in Modern Standard Arabic and regional dialects
Utilizing language-learning tools and media resources
Creating and interpreting Arabic texts and media
Applying grammar and vocabulary in diverse contexts
Leveraging digital tools for cultural and linguistic research
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Engaging in meaningful conversations in Arabic
Collaborating in group activities and role plays
ProblemSolvingAndAnalyticalSkills: Analyzing sociolinguistic nuances in Arabic-speaking cultures
Interpreting and synthesizing information from Arabic media
Developing context-appropriate communication strategies
Evaluating cultural and linguistic aspects of Middle Eastern societies
Adapting to different language registers and dialects
OrganizationalAndLeadershipSkills: Managing language acquisition projects effectively
Organizing study groups for collaborative learning
Planning and preparing for immersive cultural experiences
Leading discussions on Middle Eastern topics
Mentoring peers in Arabic language and cultural studies

IntermediateArabic.Description: The class is a continuous sequence of ARAB 111F or an equivalent class. The students are expected to reach intermediate high level. The class focuses on expanding the topics of communication the students developed in the introductory class. Modern standard and Levantine Arabic will be the means of communication in class and the student will be exposed to practical grammar, authentic media and texts.  The students will produce culture through role plays and group work simulations and recognize the different registers in the targeted culture through paying attention to sociolinguistic variations.

AdvancedArabicLanguageandCultureII.Description: The purpose of the class is to reinforce the vocabulary and grammar introduced in ARAB 111F and ARAB 212 through activating the learned materials and pushing the students to the advanced level. The language of interaction will be Levantine and Standard Arabic, which students will be able to manipulate to the specific language situations as in the countries this deglosic phenomenon exists.  In addition to the grammar and vocabulary introduced in the textbook, the class will incorporate an extensive authentic reading component and a variety of Arabic contemporary media to reflect the linguistic and cultural aspects of the Middle East.
